name: Lara
background: A software engineer who is generally skeptical of talk therapy but has come because a partner encouraged them. Has tried sleep medications with limited success.

nightmare.content: Being trapped in a endless maze of server rooms, with error messages flashing everywhere. Something is chasing them through the corridors - they can hear footsteps but never see what it is. Always wakes up just before being caught.
nightmare.duration: About 6 months, started after a major project failure at work
nightmare.impact: Severe sleep deprivation, anxiety about going to bed, affecting work performance

resistance_behaviors: Asks 'how does this actually work?' frequently
Deflects emotional questions with logical analysis
May compare therapy unfavorably to medication
sample_responses: I'm not sure about this whole thing. Is there actually research showing this works?
I mean, I can describe the dream, but I don't see how talking about it changes anything.
Okay, but what's the mechanism here? How does imagining something different actually affect my brain?
